page.title: 08ECOLOGY
page.content: Weather in this part of E.Cornwall is mild and wet with a prevailing South Westerly wind.Snow and heavy frost do not last long.Autumn is often mild and dry.Many springs rise, giving five streams in the mid and west of the area,to flow into the River Lynher.In the east there are three tributaries of the River Tamar.The district has a network of small roads, public footpaths and old green lanes.An ancient ley crosses from N.E.to s.w. Local people have an innate respect for nature.There is some shooting for the pot and an occasional fox cull, but little else.The low incidence of T.B.in cows has,so far,kept badgers safe.The policy of Cornwall County Council of cutting hedges and verges once a yearand leaving verges unsprayedis welcomed.As is the appointment of a Conservation Officer.
